text:
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.apache.tools.zip.ZipOutputStream.finish(ZipOutputStream.java(Comp
iled Code))
        at java.util.zip.DeflaterOutputStream.close(DeflaterOutputStream.java:13
9)
        at org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.Zip.execute(Zip.java:453)
        at org.apache.tools.ant.Task.perform(Task.java:341)
        at org.apache.tools.ant.Target.execute(Target.java:309)
        at org.apache.tools.ant.Target.performTasks(Target.java:336)
        at org.apache.tools.ant.Project.executeTarget(Project.java:1339)
        at org.apache.tools.ant.Project.executeTargets(Project.java:1255)
        at org.apache.tools.ant.Main.runBuild(Main.java:609)
        at org.apache.tools.ant.Main.start(Main.java:196)
        at org.apache.tools.ant.Main.main(Main.java:235)

This only happens with this version of ant. When I use 1.4 ( after deleting the
jar files ) it builds fine.
creator: estorch@us.ibm.com
antoine@apache.org
text:
I wonder why the stack trace does not show the line number in
org.apache.tools.zip.ZipOutputStream.finish
Can you make a small buildfile showing this error ?
Is your classpath set to anything specific before you start ant ?
If your classpath is set, try running your build without a classpath to see if
the problem persists.

Created attachment 8282
my build xml ( modified some names and removed some comments only)
creator: estorch@us.ibm.com
estorch@us.ibm.com
text:
the classpath is set to the following:
CLASSPATH=.;C:\db2\java\db2java.zip;C:\db2\java\runtime.zip;C:\db2\java\sqlj.zip
;C:\db2\bin

Nothing else is set in the classpath. Without the classpath set I get compile
errors due to DB2 stuff.

creator: estorch@us.ibm.com
text: The strange thing is if I use ant 1.4 I don't get that error!

creator: antoine@apache.org
text:
I looked up similar problems in bugzilla and I found out this : ------- Additional Comments From Stefan Bodewig 2002-09-25 16:39 -------
I think all the reports here as well as those on the mailing lists indicate it
is a bug in IBM's JIT that has been fixed in IBM's JDK 1.3.1 - and that is
triggered by Ant in some way.

Not an Ant bug, workaround is to upgrade the JDK or turn of the JIT.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 11903 ***
